answers.answer: I have not had it, but just about everyone else in my family has.  I've read/heard from dr, etc that once you have GD, you'll most likely get it every Pregnancy.  ALso, there is a new study out that suggests when you have GD, you'll have diabetes when you are older.  Do NOT be discouraged.  You said you control it with your diet, etc. Sometimes those things just happen.  It's not your fault

question: I just got confirmation that I have GD yet again with PG #2. It showed up at 29 weeks with DD and now at 24 weeks with ds. I was kind of expecting this but I really would like to have at least one more child after DS. Is it safe to keep getting PG and have GD every time? I had it well controlled with diet and exercise last time and plan to do the same again. I am also worried if this means that I am just destined to be a type 2 diabetic. I am a fairly healthy eater, exercise and not overweight unless I am PG. The stats on the internet are kind of confusing on this one as to whether I will get it or not. I really want 3 kids!!! Has anyone had GD with multiple PG and did any of you develop type 2? Thanks
